Body:
I want to run a code which sends email alerts upon meeting certain condition at its GPIO pins. For this I tried to import smtplib, but I am getting the error as shown in the code section. Is there any way around? OR Am I missing something? Please help.

I tried installing smtplib by providing internet access to esp8266. I used pip, upip to install but noting seems working.

import smtplib Traceback (most recent call last): File ", line 1, in ImportError: no module named 'smtplib'

pip install smtplib Traceback (most recent call last): File ", line 1 SyntaxError: invalid syntax upip install smtplib Traceback (most recent call last): File ", line 1 SyntaxError: invalid syntax
i could import upip successfully , but cannot install smtplib. Any idea?
Getting this error:	=== import upip	=== upip.install(smtplib")	=== 	Installing to: /lib/	ssl_handshake_status: -70	Traceback (most recent call last):	  File "<stdin>"
Do you definitely have upip? [Not all ESP8266 builds do](https://docs.micropython.org/en/latest/esp8266/tutorial/intro.html#requirements).

First of all that looks like a connection problem. Can you confirm that the ESP8266 can connect to any internet service at all e.g. a simple http request? Second though, I don't see any package on PyPI called `smtplib`. smtplib itself is part of the standard Python distribution and the only MicroPython versions on PyPI are dummy placeholders. [This](https://forum.micropython.org/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=5278) might be worth a look though.
